official-title.#text:
To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding
			 companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Enhanced supervision of certain bank holding companies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113

text.#text: The table of contents for the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by striking the item relating to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
usc/12/5301/etseq

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 113. Authority to require enhanced supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial
			 companies and certain bank holding companies.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:112/ss:a/p:2/sp:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 112 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:112
Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113

quote.#text: , which have been the subject of a final determination under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 113 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113

header-in-text.#text:
Authority to require enhanced supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and
			 certain bank holding companies

text.#text: by amending the heading for such section to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c, d, e, f, g, h, i
Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:d, e, f, g, h, i, j
Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:b

header.#text: Bank holding companies subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards under section 165

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:165

text.#text:
There is a determination that bank holding companies with total consolidated assets equal to or
			 greater than $250,000,000,000 shall be subject to enhanced supervision and
			 prudential standards by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in accordance with section
			 165. Such determination shall be made if the Council, on a non-delegable
			 basis and by a vote of not fewer than

text.#text:
The Council shall review each bank holding company with total consolidated assets equal to or
			 greater than $50,000,000,000 but less than $250,000,000,000 to determine
			 whether such company shall be subject to enhanced supervision and
			 prudential standards by the

fraction.#tail:
of the voting members then
			 serving, including an affirmative vote by the Chairperson, determines that
			 material financial distress at the bank holding company, or the nature,
			 scope, size, scale, concentration, interconnectedness, or mix of the
			 activities of the bank holding company, could pose a threat to the
			 financial stability of the United States.

text.#text: the size of the bank holding company;
the interconnectedness of the bank holding company;

the extent of readily available substitutes or financial institution infrastructure for the
			 services of the bank holding company;
the global cross-jurisdictional activity of the bank holding company; and
the complexity of the bank holding company.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the Council shall consider the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c/p:2/sp:A

text.#text:
the Council finds that the nature, scope, size, scale, concentration, interconnectedness, or mix of
			 the activities of the bank holding company have significantly changed and
			 the company should be reviewed again to determine if it may pose a threat
			 to the financial stability of the United States; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c/p:2/sp:A

text.#text: a period of 36 months has passed since the bank holding company was last reviewed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is not subject to
			 enhanced supervision and prudential standards, the Council shall perform
			 an additional review under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c/p:2/sp:A
Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c/p:2/sp:A

text.#text: With respect to a bank holding company described under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be subject to enhanced supervision
			 and prudential standards, the Council shall provide the bank holding
			 company with written notice of such determination and an explanation of
			 the Council’s reasoning for such determination.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c/p:2/sp:A

text.#text:
If, after a review under this paragraph, the Council determines that a bank holding company
			 described under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is subject to
			 enhanced supervision and prudential standards, the Council finds, on a
			 non-delegable basis and by a vote of not fewer than
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:113/ss:c/p:2/sp:A

text.#text: If, with respect to a bank holding company described under

fraction.#tail:
of the voting
			 members then serving, including an affirmative vote by the Chairperson,
			 that material financial distress at the bank holding company, or the
			 nature, scope, size, scale, concentration, interconnectedness, or mix of
			 the activities of the bank holding company, do not pose a threat to the
			 financial stability of the United States, such company shall no longer be
			 subject to enhanced supervision and prudential standards.

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the earlier of the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
issues final regulations to carry out
			 the amendment made by this section; or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Financial Stability Oversight Council

text.#text: the end of the 18-month period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Financial Stability Oversight Council

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

text.#text: issue regulations to carry out the amendments made by this section—

in proposed form, not later than the end of the 90-day period beginning on the date of the
			 enactment of this Act; and

in final form, not later than the end of the 180-day period beginning on the date of the enactment
			 of this Act; and

such final regulations shall take effect not later than the end of the 1-year period beginning on
			 the date of the enactment of this Act.

consolidated asset size remains a factor, but only one of many factors, that should be considered
			 in determining systemic risk; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as modified by this Act, represent a
			 more accurate indicator of systemic risk.
